#Text=Find Festivals and Special Events in Denver
#Text=Denver residents dedicate more money to public arts funding than any other community in America .
#Text=The importance that residents place on the arts is evident the large number of festivals and special events in Denver throughout the year .
#Text=From the 100-year old National Western Stock Show to the Colorado Renaissance Festival , the Mile High City has an event to suit every taste , nearly every weekend of the year .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Review the Denver Convention and Visitor 's Bureau ( CVB ) website for the most comprehensive list of major music , art , theater and sporting events in Denver .

#Text=Click on the " Events " link at the top of the home page to find festivals and special events ranging from the Denver Rocky Mountain Horse Expo in February to Denver Restaurant Week in October .

column1: #Text=Purchase a print edition of the Denver Post , Colorado 's main newspaper .

#Text=On Thursdays and Sundays you 'll find an entertainment calendar in the Post that spotlights events for the coming week , as well as reviews for past and current festivals , shows and activities .
#Text=The online edition is more comprehensive however and allows users to find festivals and special events in Denver and outlying suburbs up to 30 days prior to their event date .
#Text=Both print and online editions also include TV shows , book and restaurant reviews .
#Text=Pick up a copy of Westword , the Denver metropolitan area 's free weekly alternative newspaper .
#Text=If you 're in Denver the print edition is free and available in nearly every major retail store .
#Text=Both the print and online edition feature a weekly entertainment calendar that enables users to find festivals and events everywhere from the smallest to the largest venues .
#Text=Nightclubs and outdoor recreation event listings are also included .
#Text=Visit a Denver library for events and festivals listings .
#Text=Denver libraries serve as a repository for community groups of all sizes to post fliers about their events .
#Text=The online edition of the Denver Library system also has a searchable directory of festivals and events in Denver ranging from baby exercise classes at the library to on-site film festivals .
#Text=Shop at a local health food store to find out what 's going on .

#Text=Denver health food stores like Sunflower Markets are a great way to get a feel for the local community because they usually have bulletin boards where local residents can post fliers about everything from nearby meditation classes to animal rescue adoption days .
#Text=Many of these Denver festivals and special events will never make it into newspapers .
#Text=These bulletin boards are often the only place you 'll hear about them .
#Text=Consider the type of event that interests you , then search online for Denver-based organizations that might host a festival or special event of this type .

#Text=For example , if you are a history buff who wants to know more about Denver 's past , the organization Denver History Tours offers guided walking tours with themes ranging from historic architectural monuments to gold rush history .
#Text=Search user-generated review websites for festival and event listings .
#Text=They allow users to search for festivals and special events by city and oftentimes there are dozens of reviews posted by attendees .
#Text=Keep in mind that reviews are based on the personal experience of attendees and may not accurately reflect the collective experience of everyone who was there .
#Text=Search for " Denver " to find upcoming festivals and special events .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Denver freeways can become extremely congested during peak driving times .
#Text=Many of Denver 's most popular events will impact local freeway conditions , so always check traffic reports the day of your event .
